name: The Aurelia Blog - Page 6
description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - Early December 2018
posts.description: Over the last couple of months our awesome community has been providing great feedback and use cases for the Aurelia CLI. We're so grateful for the way that we've been able to work together. As a result, we've had several CLI updates that not only fix bugs but also add new features. You can read all the details below, along with the notes for our other recent core library and plugin releases.

posts.name: Aurelia 2018 Q3 Report
posts.description: The third quarter of 2018 was filled with major advances in our vNext Aurelia implementation along with a few cool new updates in today's Aurelia. Read on to hear about what we've accomplished and what's next as we round out 2018 and head into 2019.

posts.name: The New Aurelia-CLI Auto-tracing Bundler
posts.description: Today, we're pleased to announce the Aurelia-CLI v1.0.0-beta.1 release! The official beta of our CLI now features a new built-in "auto-tracing" bundler, which greatly improves the capability, performance, and usability of the built-in bundler.

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - Early October 2018
posts.description: As always, we continue to on improving Aurelia by both fixing bugs and adding new features. In fact, while we're hard at work on Aurelia vNext, we've also been back-porting some new features to the current version of Aurelia.

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - Early September 2018
posts.description: This month we've had big releases for the Aurelia-CLI, the Aurelia Dialog plugin and the Aurelia i18n plugin. Read on to get the details...

posts.name: CoinMesh brings Litecoin and Bitcoin dApp development to Aurelia developers
posts.description: Today, we're thrilled to invite former core team member and long-time Aurelia community member, Patrick Walters, to share a special announcement regarding the exciting, new project he's been working on. Let's hear what Patrick has been up to...

posts.name: Aurelia vNext
posts.description: The codebase of today's Aurelia is approaching 4 years old. Much has changed in the industry since 2014, with advances in JavaScript, TypeScript, module loading, packaging, browsers, tooling, and much more. We've worked hard over the years to maintain full backwards compatibility and minimal-to-no breaking changes. We're one of the only frameworks that has managed to achieve this. Most other frameworks have several major breaking change releases every year. Aurelia's stability is something we know our community appreciates, and it's something we're very proud of. That said, it has been almost four years and the time has finally come to think about Aurelia's next major version.
